p: The essential oil presented a yield of 3.8%, a density of 0.989 g/mL at 25°C, and a refractive index (ND 25) of 1.595. It was soluble in 90% (v/v) ethanol at a ratio of 1 : 2 and exhibited a transparent yellow color with a clear appearance in all samples. Chemical compounds in S. aromaticum essential oil evaluated by GC-MS are shown in Figure 1. Five major compounds were determined in the S. aromaticum essential oil and enumerated in order of elution and retention time. The major constituent was eugenol, representing 52.53% ( Table 1).
